intro: Protium paniculatum, commonly known as the Caribbean beech, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in panicles, followed by oval, woody fruits that contain a single seed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal forests and mountainous regions. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
